Package com.cyc.kb.exception

This package contains the exception hierarchy in the KB API.

See: Description

  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CreateException
    Thrown when code fails to find or create something from the Cyc KB.
    DeleteException
    Thrown when code fails to delete something from the Cyc KB.
    InvalidFormulaInContextException
    Thrown when the Cyc does not allow the specified formula to be true in the specified context.
    InvalidNameException
    Thrown when code attempts to create a KB entity with an invalid name.
    KBApiException
    Root class for exceptions thrown by the KB API.
    KBApiRuntimeException
    Root class for runtime exceptions thrown by the KB API.
    KBApiServerSideException
    Wrap all Cyc server and Base API errors, when a more specific semantic error can not be thrown.
    KBObjectNotFoundException
    Thrown when a term or a formula cannot be found from the specified context.
    KBTypeConflictException
    Thrown when an entity exists in the KB, but is incompatible with a particular semantic object type.
    KBTypeException
    Thrown when an entity exists in the KB, but does not currently meet the requirements of a particular semantic object type.
    StaleKBObjectException
    Thrown when a stale KBObject is passed to a method.
    VariableArityException
    Thrown when the arity a Relation without a fixed arity is requested.

Package com.cyc.kb.exception Description

This package contains the exception hierarchy in the KB API. KBApiException is the root level exception for KB API. All other exceptions thrown by the API are sub-classes of this. StaleKBObjectException is thrown when the Java program uses an object reference that points to a KB concept that has been deleted, by calling the API delete method. KBApiRuntimeException is thrown mostly wrapping any lower-level connection exceptions. Refer to individual exception documentation for more details.
